required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Partnering With Food Bank to Provide Tobacco Treatment to Underserved Smokers
clinical_study.official_title: Partnering With a State Food Bank to Provide Tobacco Treatment to Underserved Smokers (Project NOURISH)

lead_sponsor.agency: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

clinical_study.source: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the efficacy and economic impact of a theoretically-based, fully automated, interactive smartphone-based smoking cessation intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Self Reported 7 Day Abstinence Smoking Status
primary_outcome.description: Participants will self report 7-day abstinence smoking status

secondary_outcome.measure: Smoking Status by Saliva Cotinine Kit
secondary_outcome.description: Investigators will verify smoking status by collecting cotinine sample from a saliva cotinine kit.
Number of participants who report they quit smoking for 24 hours
Number of participants who report they quit smoking for 30 days
Number of participants who report they quit smoking

arm_group.description: Participants randomized to Standard Treatment (ST) will be provided with a 10-week supply of nicotine patches and lozenges. ST participants will be connected with Florida Quitline services and will complete weekly 4-item smartphone assessments electronically for 26 weeks. The weekly assessments consist of questions on smoking status, motivation, self-efficacy, and perceived stress.

Participants randomized to Automated Treatment (AT) will be given a 10-week supply of nicotine patches and lozenges. AT will also comprise of: 1) 12 proactive treatment videos, delivered weekly, that are tailored on smoking status, motivation, agency, and/or negative affect/stress; 2) 26 weeks of on-demand access to treatment content; 3) 26 weeks of text content

intervention.description: An interactive smartphone-based intervention that comprises content delivered via audio/video clips and text content automatically each week to the participant
Participants will be provided with a 10-week supply of nicotine patches
Phone counseling with the Florida Quitline
Participants will be provided with a 10-week supply of nicotine lozenges

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- >100 lifetime cigarettes
- English or Spanish speaking
- Currently smoke > 5 cigarettes/day
- Willing to make a quit attempt within 1 week of enrollment
- Process a smartphone compatible with the project app
- Have a valid email address
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medical condition that precludes use of Nicotine Replacement Therapy
- Current use of smoking cessation medications
- Enrolled in a smoking cessation study
- Household member enrolled in the study
- Inadequate health literacy
- Failure to electronically confirm participation with 7 days of randomization via electronic link sent to participant's smartphone
